_description: Anticlerical verse on the devil becoming a monk — one long couplet or quatrain rhyming second and fourth lines

CULFf631.Transcription:
The devill was sicke the devill a monk would beThe devill was well
                    the devill a monke was he
CULFf631.Note:
Preceded by Latin equivalent, ‘Daemon Languebat Monachum fieri
                        uolebat / Daemon conualuit mansit ut ante fuit’; added by a hand
                    of sixteenth centuruy.
